meanings.definition: In an elfish manner; mischievously or playfully.
meanings.sent1: She giggled elfishly as she hid behind the tree during the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent2: The children played elfishly in the forest, pretending to be magical creatures.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail elfishly, trying to catch the attention of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous squirrel darted elfishly from tree to tree, avoiding capture.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes sparkled elfishly as she planned a surprise for her friend.

meanings.definition: With characteristics or qualities associated with elves.
meanings.sent1: The girl wore an elfishly pointed hat to the costume party.
meanings.sent2: The forest had an elfishly magical aura, with twinkling lights and mysterious sounds.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with elfishly intricate designs made of frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had an elfishly musical quality that enchanted everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The old book had an elfishly delicate cover, adorned with tiny silver stars.
